alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Kimball and southwestern Banner Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oliver Reservoir, or near Kimball, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Dix, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 10 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
